content: The Anthrax Victims Fund Fairness Act of 2003 is referenced in the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001. It provides compensation for victims of terrorist acts. The Anthrax Victims Fund Fairness Act of 2003 expands eligibility for compensation to include victims of terrorist-related anthrax infections in the United States between September 13, 2001, and November 30, 2001. The Anthrax Victims Fund Fairness Act of 2003 expands compensation eligibility to include victims of terrorist-related anthrax infections in the United States between September 13, 2001, and November 30, 2001. Amendments include extending the time limit to 3 years, adding collateral compensation for anthrax infections, and adjusting eligibility criteria for individuals. The Anthrax Victims Fund Fairness Act of 2003 expands compensation eligibility to include individuals who suffered physical harm or death from a terrorist-related anthrax infection in the United States between September 13, 2001, and November 30, 2001. The Attorney General, in consultation with the Special Master, must create regulations within 90 days of the Act's enactment. These regulations will cover forms for submitting claims, required information, hearing procedures, assistance for claim filing, and other relevant matters.
